label: 行啓
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: When the Empress Dowager (Kōtaigō), Empress (Kōgō, or Chūgū), and the Crown Prince (Kōtaishi) leave their palaces to go any place in state they are said to be paying an imperial visit (gyōkei). [皇太后、皇后、中宮、皇太子]
